pageContext.claim: “While the Fake News loves to talk about my so-called low approval rating, @foxandfriends just showed that my rating on Dec. 28, 2017, was approximately the same as President Obama on Dec. 28, 2009, which was 47%...and this despite massive negative Trump coverage & Russia hoax!”
pageContext.analysis: Trump is relying on a single Republican-leaning poll, Rasmussen Reports, which has a poor record of accuracy. A better measure of popularity is an average of polls. The 538 website on this day showed that Trump had an average approval rating of 37.7 percent, which reflects the inclusion of the Rasmussen poll. By contrast, Obama had an approval rating of 49.6 percent on the 343rd day of his presidency. Moreover, Trump had a disapproval rating of 56.4 percent, compared to 43.8 percent for Obama.
